User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account within the Kivo application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

username.description: The username chosen by the user.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

lastLogin.description: Timestamp indicating the user's last login.

profilePicture.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. The `userId` is the Firebase Authentication UID. Enforces path-based ownership for data isolation and security.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Authentication UID of the user.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support user authentication and account management features for the Kivo application. The core principle is to ensure data isolation and security through path-based ownership. User data is stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, providing a natural and secure way to manage individual user profiles. This approach provides Authorization Independence, as access control can be directly tied to the `userId` without needing to query other documents. Since there is only user data, Structural Segregation is less applicable here.
